Setting up hierarchical display of files
Hierarchical file display setting is used to define rules (conditions) of filtering (classification) of attached files when displaying them. It is represents as an object type
“Configuring hierarchical representation of files” [FS_HIER]
This configuration type is used to work with the
“File Hierarchy”
and
“Explorer”
widgets, which display a hierarchy of attached files.
Hierarchical representation
Consider a (simplified) scheme for organizing hierarchical file representation.
Configuring the hierarchical representation of files [FS_HIER] assumes:
creating a named hierarchy record with object type specification;
mapping a hierarchy of multiple tops related to attribute types, classifications, and file tags.
The algorithmic effect on the hierarchy elements is variable and depends on the nature of the task to be solved .
Setup
To customize the hierarchical file representation is required to:
Go to the registry type
“ Configuring the hierarchical representation of files” [FS_HIER]
, create a new type instance by clicking on
and fill in the settings:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the setting name.
Object type
Defining the object type whose hierarchical file representation is to be configured.
Default view mode
Selecting the default file viewing mode. Possible values:
Tile;
Table.
When working with
Explorer widget
to display files, this setting is not taken into account.
Visibility algorithm for the "Delete tags" button
Selecting/entering an algorithm to determine the conditions for displaying the "Delete tags" button. Used in
Explorer widget
.
Visibility algorithm for the "Assign tags" button
Selecting/entering an algorithm to determine the conditions for displaying the "Assign tags" button. Used in
Explorer widget
.
Algorithm to name downloaded files
Selecting/entering algorithm for naming files when downloading multiple files as an archive.
Algorithm to name the downloaded archive
Selecting/entering algorithm for naming archive when downloading multiple files as an archive.
Then it is necessary to configure the display of nodes. Each top (node) represents a child object type.
To set a hierarchy node, click
and fill in the following basic parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the name of the setting (top). This name will be displayed to the user if the node is not hidden.
Configuring hierarchical representation of files
Selecting the hierarchy setting from the drop-down list. This hierarchy is set by the object type
“Configuring hierarchical representation of files” object type [FS_HIER]
object type for which the top is configured.
Parent
Selecting the parent node of the hierarchy.
Setting up file definitions
Object type
Defining an object type with an attribute containing files to be displayed in a configurable top.
Selection is made using a drop-down list from all types of objects of the System.
Algorithm for determining objects
Selecting an algorithm for determining objects. In this case, the basic type of this algorithm must be equal to the type of the object on the visual of which the widget is used.
The algorithm should return an object or a collection of objects containing the files.
Type attribute
Determining the type attribute containing the files to be displayed in the configurable top.
Algorithm for determining files
Selecting an algorithm to determine the files to be displayed in the configurable top.
The algorithm will be run on the objects that were returned by the algorithm specified in the “ Algorithm for determining objects” field.
Used when the “Type attribute” field value is empty.
Setting up the classification definition*
Classification
Selecting the classifications of attached files to display.
The selection is made by means of a drop-down list of instances of
"File classification” [FS_FILE_KIND]
type.
Algorithm for determining classification
Selecting an algorithm to determine the classifications.
The algorithm will be executed on the objects that were returned by the algorithm specified in the “ Algorithm for determining objects ” field.
Used when the value of the “Classifications” field is empty.
If necessary, in the “Setting up restrictions on actions with files” block restrictions on actions with files can be set, and in the “Setting up top visualization in explorer” block the following parameters are used to set up top visualization in explorer:
Setting
Purpose
Setting up restrictions on actions with files
Set file movement limit
Specifying how to set the file move restriction. Possible options:
algorithm with classifications;
algorithm with files.
Algorithm with classifications for which moving files is not available
Specifying the algorithm by which the file movement restriction will be set.
The algorithm should return classifications.
Algorithm with files for which file replacement is not available
Specifying the algorithm by which the file movement restriction will be set.
The algorithm should return a collection of files.
Set file replacement limit
Specifying how to set the file replacement restriction. Possible options:
algorithm with classifications;
algorithm with files.
Algorithm with classifications for which file replacement is not available
Specifying the algorithm by which the file replacement restriction will be set.
The algorithm should return classifications.
Algorithm with files for which file replacement is not available
Specifying the algorithm by which the file replacement restriction will be set.
The algorithm should return a collection of files.
Set the current version selection restriction
Specifying how to set a restriction to select the current version of the files. Possible options:
algorithm with classifications;
algorithm with files.
Algorithm with classifications for which current version selection is not available
Specifying the algorithm by which the restriction on the selection of the current version of files will be set.
The algorithm should return classifications.
Algorithm with files for which current version selection is not available
Specifying the algorithm by which the restriction for selecting the current version of the files will be set.
The algorithm should return a collection of files.
Set file deletion limit
Specifying how to set the file deletion restriction. Possible options:
algorithm with classifications;
algorithm with files.
Algorithm with classifications for which deleting files is not available
Specifying the algorithm by which the file deletion restriction will be set.
The algorithm should return classifications.
Algorithm with files for which deleting files is not available
Specifying the algorithm by which the file deletion restriction will be set.
The algorithm should return a collection of files.
Algorithm with classifications for which adding files is not available
Specifying the algorithm by which the restriction on adding files will be set.
The algorithm should return classifications.
Algorithm with classifications for which versioning is not available
Specifying the algorithm by which the file versioning restriction will be set.
The algorithm should return classifications.
Setting up top visualization in explorer
Collapse top
Determining the display of the top files.  When set, the top files will be hidden, while folders will be displayed.
Hide on the right side of the classification folder
Determining the display of classification folders. When set, the classification folders will be hidden in the right part of the explorer and the files from these folders will be displayed.
Hide node
Defining the display of the parent node name in the widget.
Hide title
Determining the display of the node title name in the widget.
Build a hierarchy of classification folders
Determining the hierarchy structure of classifications folders when displayed. When set, the system considers the received classifications up to the first common folder, after which it will display their structure: from the common folder to the specified classifications.
Display folder icon
Determining the display of the folder icon.
Hide top if there are no related objects
Determining the display of the top depending on the presence of objects. When set, the top will be hidden if no objects containing files were found using the algorithm specified in the “ Algorithm for determining objects” field.
Disallow attaching files
Determining the possibility of attaching files. When set, file attachment will be prohibited for the current top. The checkbox does not apply to child tops.
Folder styling algorithm
Defining a folder styling algorithm.
The selection is made from a drop-down list of pre-made
formatting styles
.
Styling algorithms for files
Defining an algorithm to visually highlight files. Using the algorithm, it is possible, for example, to set highlighting of files added after a specified date.
The selection is made from a drop-down list of pre-made
formatting styles
.
If it is necessary to customize separate sets of classifications (for example, for Surety-Physical Person and Surety-Legal Person) it is necessary to add
two
tops with corresponding algorithms for determining objects for the current node.
If the configured algorithm for determining objects for the current node returns an empty collection, that node is not displayed in
File hierarchy widget
.
